home.title: Hi, my name is
home.name: Dylan
home.subtitle: I'm a web developer who graduated from OpenClassrooms in 2024.

bio.title: Who am I?
bio.paragraph1: At the age of 25, I turned my passion for video games and IT into a profession thanks to a training course on OpenClassrooms, which enabled me to obtain my web integrator developer certification in 2024. It was a childhood dream that came true after hours (many hours!) of learning and practice.
bio.paragraph2: I'm the kind of developer who spends entire evenings fine-tuning the details - I can't help it! This attention to detail keeps my code readable and well structured. What really makes me tick? Seeing a project come to life, solving complex problems and constantly learning.
bio.paragraph3: Each bug solved is a small personal victory that pushes me to surpass myself and explore new possibilities.

gaming.title: Gaming enthusiast
gaming.description: Passionate about strategy games, I enjoy taking on complex challenges and finding optimal solutions. This analytical and methodical approach guides my development work, where each project is approached with thought and precision.

learning.title: Lifelong learning
learning.description: I'm constantly looking to improve and learn new technologies to stay at the cutting edge. Technology watch is an integral part of my routine.

music.title: Music
music.description: Music helps me concentrate during long coding sessions. It stimulates my creativity and improves my productivity when I'm developing.

certif.description:
This level 5 professional certification attests to my ability to design, develop and deploy complete IT solutions, from needs analysis through to production launch.

Covering the entire web development cycle, it validates my technical skills (front-end/back-end, API, testing), my mastery of project methodologies and my ability to optimize application performance to meet user requirements.
